lines.text: If only I could be old, old for one day, twenty-five years old. Even a day of problems, a trip to the obstetrician or a marriage counselor, a secret day with a married man. Just to be twenty-five for a flash. That would hold me forever.
It'll be a... a play for the ages!

[excitedly]
Ooh, will there be potato salad?

[to Sara, angrily]
We DID have faith! Maybe not *your* kind of faith, but we had it, all right! And a little happiness never hurt anyone!
Reputation... that's a very grown-up word.

[solemnly, sounding wise beyond his years]
So's 'dying'.
[Philip runs into the woods before Eugene an reply]
My mother says you may linger for a while.
Your mother's a fat bitch.
Deirdre!
Oh, that's OK. My daddy's always calling her that.

[upon knowing that Deirdre is going to probably die over the summer]
... Happy birthday, kid.
[sadly walks away]

[to Philip as the sun beams down on them both]
I wish I could see what you'll look like when you're grown-up.

[Deirdre has collapsed on the ground after dancing outside, and Ruth sees her husband staring in shock]
You let her DANCE!
[her husband gets out of his stupor and rushes over to his daughter]

[while lying there at the beach in Nova Scotia, hand-in-hand with Deirdre]
I hope sex is as nice as this!

[Philip sees Deirdre painting her face with makeup to make herself look like an old hag on purpose]
Wow, you look SEXY!
It'll be a play about...
[in unison with Philip]
...REPUTATION!
[Eugene hugs Philip and spins around with him in the sunshine]
I'm not interested in sex, I'm interested in rooms!

[about Dierdre's heart condition]
Maybe it's a punishment because you're parents don't believe in God.

[about Dierdre]
can't you leave her with some DIGNITY?

[talking to Sara about Philip]
I think he's Dierdre's only real friend.

[about Philip]
that boy should NOT be over here! He's mentally unbalanced, and...!
[her words falter when she sees Dierdre's father rolling around in the grass with his daughter like a lunatic]

[last lines of the film]
... You wouldn't remember me.
[Philip runs away to the beach, crying while Dierdre calls out his name]
